snippet: New Hampshire’s attorney general is threatening legal action against prominent polling firms, invoking a state law against spreading negative information through poll questions.
abstract: New Hampshire Attorney General Michael A Delaney is threatening legal action against some of the nation's most prominent polling firms; says polls are breaking state law against spreading negative information through poll questions that could limit public opinion surveys in one of the nation’s most politically contested states; some polling firms have begun cautioning their employees to tread lightly in New Hampshire until the law is clarified.
lead_paragraph: New Hampshire’s attorney general is threatening legal action against prominent polling firms, invoking a state law against spreading negative information through poll questions.

headline.main: Law Has Polling Firms Leery of Work in New Hampshire
headline.print_headline: Law Has Polling Firms Leery of New Hampshire
